lead_paragraph: Out of the cage, they speak their own language, make tools, and wreak havoc on plants and researchers’ efforts alike.

headline.main: Parrots Are a Lot More Than ‘Pretty Bird’

snippet: Out of the cage, they speak their own language, make tools, and wreak havoc on plants and researchers’ efforts alike.
abstract: Parrots, birds revered for their colorful plumage, are perhaps more remarkable for intelligence researchers say rivals that of great apes and dolphins; psittaciformes, avian order that includes parrots, parakeets, macaws and cockatoos, have been found to have ability to fashion tools, communicate in distinct dialects and sabotage research equipment; recent discoveries are described book Parrots of the Wild: A Natural History of the World’s Most Captivating Birds by Catherine A Toft and Timothy F Wright.

keywords.name: creative_works
keywords.value: Parrots of the Wild: A Natural History of the World's Most Captivating Birds (Book)
